# Discord Channel Analysis: ðŸ’»â”‚developers

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily focused on curve-based mesh manipulation and developer tools. Gert-Jan Akerboom shared progress on a "followcurve" app that allows meshes to follow a 2D curve with configurable parameters like amount and radius. There was discussion about the need for line/curve support in GLTF exporters and potential implementation of curve nodes in Hyperfy V2. Peezy announced the release of IDE scripting functionality via hypkg, with an alternative GitHub branch for those not using hypkg. Lastraum integrated .hyp files into a UGC Catalog with 6,300+ assets. Questions about NPCs, parent objects, and VRM emotes in Hyperfy V1 were also discussed, with some technical limitations noted regarding object hierarchies in apps. A user sought help with Mixamo animations for VRM emotes, specifically with keeping feet planted on the ground.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Is there a way to add NPCs in Hyperfy v1? (asked by carlosmu) A: Yes, a VRM can be an app that moves around, and you can even prompt AIs and put the response in chat (answered by peezy)
Q: Can I create a parent object in Hyperfy v1? (asked by carlosmu) A: Not directly within apps yet, but you could export objects as one from a 3D program or handle it programmatically by setting the model as a prop of the app (answered by peezy)
Q: Do we have a database of vrm compatible emotes? (asked by carlosmu) A: Unanswered
Q: How do I solve the problem of feet not staying planted on the ground when using Mixamo animations for emotes? (asked by carlosmu) A: Root bone (answered by 0mka)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: peezy | Helpee: carlosmu | Context: Asked about implementing NPCs and parent objects in Hyperfy v1 | Resolution: Explained VRMs can be used as NPCs with AI responses, and suggested workarounds for parent objects
Helper: 0mka | Helpee: carlosmu | Context: Problem with feet not staying planted on ground when using Mixamo animations for VRM emotes | Resolution: Suggested "root bone" as the solution
Helper: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Helpee: Community | Context: Shared a "followcurve" app for arranging meshes along a curve | Resolution: Provided a working implementation with UI controls for amount and radius parameters

# Analysis of ðŸª™â”‚hyper Discord Channel

## 1. Summary:
The chat segment contains limited technical discussion. The main technical point clarified is that the Hyper platform will automatically inject wallet and Hyper integrations into all worlds without requiring developers to implement anything on their end. There was also discussion about the open-source nature of the project, noting that while developers could create their own ecosystems without using HYPER tokens, the team might develop incentives for projects to incorporate HYPER into their economies. Some users discussed Sui blockchain, questioning its value proposition and speculating about its VC backing, particularly in relation to Delorean Labs choosing Sui over alternatives like Base or Solana.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Are there plans to make the coin a native part of the open source platform? Or does it require the SOL hypkg to integrate? (asked by Mugenomics) A: The platform will inject wallet and hyper integrations directly into all worlds without needing to do anything on the world side. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: What if New Agents built & connected to hyper world but they only promote & accept their own tokens? (asked by ai16zgm) A: It is an open source project, if people want to use it to create their own ecosystem they will be able to do that. (answered by jar0d)
Q: Can some explain to me if I should give a shit about sui? (asked by general hyper) A: Unanswered
